Text.content:
Use the Resource types app to crate a new resource type:

  • From the Quick launch menu, open the Launchpad
  • In the Launchpad, click on the resource types app
  • Start creating a new resource type by clicking on the wand icon in the Main toolbar
  • When asked for a module, choose the newly created module org.opencms.examples.formatterconfig from above
  • In the Add new resource type dialog, type in the following data:
    • Name: example-formatter-configuration
    • XPath element-name: ExampleFormatterConfiguration
    • Display name: Example formatter configuration
    • Description: Example formatter configuration.
  • Leave the rest as is and click on save

This creates our example content type that will be enabled for editing and publication on a webiste at the end of this chapter.

It also creates a basic formatter configuration. To verify that the formatter configuration is available, use the Explorer to open the newly created file at /system/modules/org.opencms.examples.formatterconfig/formatters/example-formatter-configuration.xml.

The resource types app already prepared some important configurations:

  • Resource type links the formatter with the content type
  • JSP links the formatter JSP also created by the resource types app
